alert.note: Alert for Chaves; De Baca; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 26 at 6:45PM MDT until May 26 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Roosevelt County in east central New Mexico... Southeastern De Baca County in east central New Mexico... North central Chaves County in southeastern New Mexico... * Until 745 PM MDT. * At 645 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 22 miles northwest of Kenna, or 30 miles south of Fort Sumner, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Roosevelt, southeastern De Baca and north central Chaves Counties. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southeastern and east central New Mexico. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
